page.title: 05Main Features in Twyford
page.content: One of the main features of Twyford is the mill. The mill is called B.B.O. This stands for Berks,Bucks and Oxon. The farmers make animal food. It is run as a co-operative society which means that it is run by a group of farmers working together. Old records have shown that there was a mill on the banks of the Loddon river in 1163. It is 1976 that most people will remember because on the third of October the mill was set on fire and totally destroyed. The mill was rebuilt in 1979 and it is one of the most modern mills in the country. Some more of the main features in Twyford are Bridge House, the Old Farmhouse, quite a few pubs and the Almshouses. The Almshouses used to be a courthouse. Then they were turned into a library. Now it is used for old people to live in.
